00033 #include <assert.h>
00034 #include <stdio.h>
00035 #include <stdint.h>
00036 #include <string.h>
00037 #include "cparser.h"
00038 #include "cparser_priv.h"
00039 #include "cparser_token.h"
00040 
00042 #define NELEM(a) (sizeof(a)/sizeof(a[0]))
00043 
00044 #define SET_TOKEN(t, s)                 \
00045     strcpy((t).buf, (s));               \
00046     (t).token_len = strlen(s)
00047 
00051 cparser_result_t 
00052 cparser_input (cparser_t *parser, char ch, cparser_char_t ch_type)
00053 {
00054     return CPARSER_OK;
00055 }
00056 
00065 int main (int argc, char *argv[])
00066 {
00067     /* 
00068      * A set of list node for a LIST token. The keyword list is:
00069      *
00070      * all -> configuration -> states -> stats -> memory
00071      */
00072     cparser_list_node_t list_node_memory = { NULL, "memory" };
00073     cparser_list_node_t list_node_stats = { &list_node_memory, "stats" };
00074     cparser_list_node_t list_node_states = { &list_node_stats, "states" };
00075     cparser_list_node_t list_node_configuration = { &list_node_states, "configuration" };
00076     cparser_list_node_t list_node_all = { &list_node_configuration, "all" };
00077 
00078     struct {
00079         char                *name;
00080         char                *str;
00081         cparser_node_type_t type;
00082         void                *param;
00083         cparser_result_t    result;
00084         int                 is_complete;
00085     } match_testcases[] = {
00086         /* Keyword */
00087         { "KW01", "s", CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD, "show", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00088         { "KW02", "sh", CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD, "show", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00089         { "KW03", "sho", CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD, "show", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00090         { "KW04", "show", CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD, "show", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00091         { "KW05", "shows", CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD, "show", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00092         { "KW06", "how", CPARSER_NODE_KEYWORD, "show", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00093         /* String */
00094         { "STR01", "abc", CPARSER_NODE_STRING, "s", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00095         { "STR02", "1234", CPARSER_NODE_STRING, "s", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00096         /* 32-bit unsigned integer */
00097         { "UINT01", "1xabc", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00098         { "UINT02", "0xabc", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00099         { "UINT03", "01234", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00100         { "UINT04", "012abc", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00101         { "UINT05", "0x", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00102         { "UINT06", "1x", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00103         /* 64-bit unsigned integer */
00104         { "UINT64_01", "1xabc", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00105         { "UINT64_02", "0xabcdef0123456789", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00106         { "UINT64_03", "01234567890123456789", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00107         { "UINT64_04", "012abc", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00108         { "UINT64_05", "0x", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00109         { "UINT64_06", "1x", CPARSER_NODE_UINT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00110         /* 32-bit signed integer */
00111         { "INT01", "123", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00112         { "INT02", "9876543210", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1},
00113         { "INT03", "abc", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00114         { "INT04", "-980", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00115         { "INT05", "-", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00116         { "INT06", "+", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00117         { "INT07", "+5678", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00118         { "INT08", "1324-80", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00119         /* 64-bit signed integer */
00120         { "INT64_01", "123", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00121         { "INT64_02", "98765432109876543210", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1},
00122         { "INT64_03", "abc", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00123         { "INT64_04", "-98098054321", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00124         { "INT64_05", "-", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00125         { "INT64_06", "+", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00126         { "INT64_07", "+5678", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00127         { "INT64_08", "1324-80", CPARSER_NODE_INT, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00128         /* 32-bit hexadecimal */

00130         { "HEX02", "0x0123456", CPARSER_NODE_HEX, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00131         { "HEX03", "1x1234", CPARSER_NODE_HEX, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },

00134         /* 64-bit hexadecimal */
00135         { "HEX64_01", "0x78abcdef123456789", CPARSER_NODE_HEX, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00136         { "HEX64_02", "0x0123456", CPARSER_NODE_HEX, "a", CPARSER_OK, 1 },

00139         { "HEX64_05", "0xyz", CPARSER_NODE_HEX, "a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },        
00140         /* Float */
00141         /* MAC address */

00143         { "MAC02", "00", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00144         { "MAC03", "00:", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00145         { "MAC04", "00:1", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00146         { "MAC05", "00:11", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00147         { "MAC06", "00:11:", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00148         { "MAC07", "00:11:9", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00149         { "MAC08", "00:11:99", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00150         { "MAC09", "00:11:99:", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00151         { "MAC10", "00:11:99:a", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00152         { "MAC11", "00:11:99:aa", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00153         { "MAC12", "00:11:99:aa:", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00154         { "MAC13", "00:11:99:aa:C", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00155         { "MAC14", "00:11:99:aa:CC", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00156         { "MAC15", "00:11:99:aa:CC:", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00157         { "MAC16", "00:11:99:aa:CC:F", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00158         { "MAC17", "00:11:99:aa:CC:Ff", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00159         { "MAC18", "xx:yy:zz:pp:qq:rr", CPARSER_NODE_MACADDR, "macaddr", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00160         /* IP address */
00161         { "IP4_01", "1", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00162         { "IP4_02", "10.", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00163         { "IP4_03", "10.123", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00164         { "IP4_04", "10.123.0.", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00165         { "IP4_05", "10.123.0.1", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00166         { "IP4_06", "10.123.0.13", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00167         { "IP4_07", "1234.1.1.1", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00168         { "IP4_08", "1.2.3.3.4.5", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00169         { "IP4_09", "a.b.c.d", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00170         { "IP4_10", "172.18.256.1", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00171         { "IP4_11", "172.18.0.256", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00172         { "IP4_12", "172.18.255.1", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00173         { "IP4_13", "172.18.0.255", CPARSER_NODE_IPV4ADDR, "ipv4", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00174         /* File path */
00175         { "FILE01", "xyz.txt", CPARSER_NODE_FILE, "fname", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00176         { "FILE02", "/usr/include/stdio.h", CPARSER_NODE_FILE, "fname", CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00177         /* Keyword list */
00178         { "LIST01", "s", CPARSER_NODE_LIST, &list_node_all, CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00179         { "LIST02", "stat", CPARSER_NODE_LIST, &list_node_all, CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00180         { "LIST03", "state", CPARSER_NODE_LIST, &list_node_all, CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00181         { "LIST04", "all", CPARSER_NODE_LIST, &list_node_all, CPARSER_OK, 1 },
00182         { "LIST05", "statess", CPARSER_NODE_LIST, &list_node_all, CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00183         { "LIST06", "emory", CPARSER_NODE_LIST, &list_node_all, CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 }
00184     };
00185     int n, is_complete, num_tests = 0, num_passes = 0;
00186     int total_tests = 0, total_passes = 0;
00187     cparser_result_t result;
00188     cparser_node_t node;
00189     cparser_token_t token;
00190 
00191     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(match_testcases); n++) {
00192         node.type = match_testcases[n].type;
00193         node.param = match_testcases[n].param;
00194         is_complete = 0xff;
00195         assert(cparser_match_fn_tbl[node.type]);
00196         result = cparser_match_fn_tbl[node.type](match_testcases[n].str, 
00197                                                  strlen(match_testcases[n].str), 
00198                                                  &node, &is_complete);
00199         num_tests++;
00200 
00201         if ((result == match_testcases[n].result) && 
00202             (is_complete == match_testcases[n].is_complete)) {
00203             printf("PASS: %s: ", match_testcases[n].name);
00204             num_passes++;
00205         } else {
00206             printf("FAIL: %s: ", match_testcases[n].name);
00207         }
00208         printf("'%s' -> (%d, %s) -> (%s, %s)\n", match_testcases[n].str,
00209                match_testcases[n].type, 
00210                (CPARSER_NODE_LIST != match_testcases[n].type ? 
00211                 (char *)match_testcases[n].param : "<keyword list>"),
00212                (CPARSER_OK == result ? "OK" : "NOT OK"),
00213                (is_complete ? "COMPLETE" : "INCOMPLETE"));
00214     }
00215     printf("Match function tests: %d total. %d passed.\n\n\n", 
00216            num_tests, num_passes);
00217     total_tests = num_tests;
00218     total_passes = num_passes;
00219 
00220     /* 
00221      * Test the get functions. Due to the output argument of each 
00222      * function being different. There is no table to simplify this.
00223      */
00224     num_tests = num_passes = 0;
00225 
00226     /* String */
00227     char *str = "hello, world", *str_val;
00228     SET_TOKEN(token, str);
00229     result = cparser_get_string(&token, &str_val);
00230     num_tests++;
00231     if ((CPARSER_OK != result) || (str_val != token.buf)) {
00232         printf("FAIL: STR01: %s -> %s\n", str, str_val);
00233     } else {
00234         printf("PASS: STR01: %s -> %s\n", str, str_val);
00235         num_passes++;
00236     }
00237 
00238     /* Unsigned integer */
00239     struct {
00240         char             *name;
00241         char             *str;
00242         cparser_result_t result;
00243         uint32_t         val;
00244     } get_uint_testcases[] = {
00245         { "UINT01", "0x1234abCD", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234abcd },
00246         { "UINT02", "12345678", CPARSER_OK, 12345678 },
00247         { "UINT03", "0xabcdef123", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00248         { "UINT04", "9876543210", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00249         { "UINT05", "0x0000001234", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234 },
00250         { "UINT06", "00000000000001234", CPARSER_OK, 1234 }
00251     };
00252     uint32_t uint_val;
00253     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_uint_testcases); n++) {
00254         SET_TOKEN(token, get_uint_testcases[n].str);
00255         result = cparser_get_uint(&token, &uint_val);
00256         num_tests++;
00257         if ((result != get_uint_testcases[n].result) || 
00258             (uint_val != get_uint_testcases[n].val)) {
00259             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_uint_testcases[n].name);
00260         } else {
00261             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_uint_testcases[n].name);
00262             num_passes++;
00263         }
00264         printf("%s -> %lu (%lX)\n", get_uint_testcases[n].str, 
00265                (unsigned long)uint_val, (unsigned long)uint_val);
00266     }
00267 
00268     struct {
00269         char             *name;
00270         char             *str;
00271         cparser_result_t result;
00272         uint64_t         val;
00273     } get_uint64_testcases[] = {
00274         { "UINT64_01", "0x1234abCD", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234abcd },
00275         { "UINT64_02", "12345678", CPARSER_OK, 12345678 },
00276         { "UINT64_03", "0xabcdef1234567890a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00277         { "UINT64_04", "98765432109876543210", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00278         { "UINT64_05", "0x0000001234", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234 },
00279         { "UINT64_06", "00000000000001234", CPARSER_OK, 1234 },
00280         { "UINT64_07", "0", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00281         { "UINT64_08", "0x0", CPARSER_OK, 0 },
00282         { "UINT64_09", "18446744073709551615", CPARSER_OK, 
00283           18446744073709551615ULL },
00284         { "UINT64_10", "0xffffffffffffffff", CPARSER_OK, 
00285           18446744073709551615ULL },
00286     };
00287     uint64_t uint64_val;
00288     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_uint64_testcases); n++) {
00289         SET_TOKEN(token, get_uint64_testcases[n].str);
00290         result = cparser_get_uint64(&token, &uint64_val);
00291         num_tests++;
00292         if ((result != get_uint64_testcases[n].result) || 
00293             (uint64_val != get_uint64_testcases[n].val)) {
00294             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_uint64_testcases[n].name);
00295         } else {
00296             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_uint64_testcases[n].name);
00297             num_passes++;
00298         }
00299         printf("%s -> %llu (%llX)\n", get_uint64_testcases[n].str, 
00300                (unsigned long long)uint64_val, (unsigned long long)uint64_val);

00309     } get_int_testcases[] = {
00310         { "INT01", "123", CPARSER_OK, 123 },
00311         { "INT02", "12345678", CPARSER_OK, 12345678 },
00312         { "INT03", "12345678900", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },

00323     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_int_testcases); n++) {

00370     /* Hexadecimal */
00371     struct {
00372         char             *name;
00373         char             *str;
00374         cparser_result_t result;
00375         uint32_t         val;
00376     } get_hex_testcases[] = {
00377         { "HEX01", "0x1234abCD", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234abcd },
00378         { "HEX02", "0xabcdef123", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00379         { "HEX03", "0x0000001234", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234 },
00380     };
00381     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_hex_testcases); n++) {
00382         SET_TOKEN(token, get_hex_testcases[n].str);
00383         result = cparser_get_hex(&token, &uint_val);
00384         num_tests++;
00385         if ((result != get_hex_testcases[n].result) || 
00386             (uint_val != get_hex_testcases[n].val)) {
00387             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_hex_testcases[n].name);
00388         } else {
00389             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_hex_testcases[n].name);
00390             num_passes++;
00391         }
00392         printf("%s -> %lX\n", get_hex_testcases[n].str, 
00393                (unsigned long)uint_val);
00394     }
00395 
00396     struct {
00397         char             *name;
00398         char             *str;
00399         cparser_result_t result;
00400         uint64_t         val;
00401     } get_hex64_testcases[] = {
00402         { "HEX64_01", "0x1234abCD", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234abcd },
00403         { "HEX64_02", "0xabcdef1234567890a", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0 },
00404         { "HEX64_03", "0x1234567890abcdef", CPARSER_OK, 0x1234567890abcdefULL },
00405     };
00406     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_hex64_testcases); n++) {
00407         SET_TOKEN(token, get_hex64_testcases[n].str);
00408         result = cparser_get_hex64(&token, &uint64_val);
00409         num_tests++;
00410         if ((result != get_hex64_testcases[n].result) || 
00411             (uint64_val != get_hex64_testcases[n].val)) {
00412             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_hex64_testcases[n].name);
00413         } else {
00414             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_hex64_testcases[n].name);
00415             num_passes++;
00416         }
00417         printf("%s -> %llX\n", get_hex64_testcases[n].str, 
00418                (unsigned long long)uint64_val);
00419     }

00423     /* MAC address */
00424     struct {
00425         char             *name;
00426         char             *str;
00427         cparser_result_t result;
00428         uint8_t          macaddr[6];
00429     } get_macaddr_testcases[] = {
00430         { "MAC01", "12:45:89:ab:CD:Ef", CPARSER_OK, 
00431           { 0x12, 0x45, 0x89, 0xab, 0xcd, 0xef } },
00432         { "MAC02", "1:4:9:a:C:f", CPARSER_OK, 
00433           { 0x01, 0x04, 0x09, 0x0a, 0x0c, 0x0f } },
00434     };
00435     cparser_macaddr_t macaddr;
00436     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_macaddr_testcases); n++) {
00437         SET_TOKEN(token, get_macaddr_testcases[n].str);
00438         result = cparser_get_macaddr(&token, &macaddr);
00439         num_tests++;
00440         if ((result != get_macaddr_testcases[n].result) || 
00441             (memcmp(&macaddr, get_macaddr_testcases[n].macaddr, 6))) {
00442             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_macaddr_testcases[n].name);
00443         } else {
00444             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_macaddr_testcases[n].name);
00445             num_passes++;
00446         }
00447         printf("%s -> %02X:%02X:%02X:%02X:%02X:%02X\n", 
00448                get_macaddr_testcases[n].str, macaddr.octet[0], 
00449                macaddr.octet[1], macaddr.octet[2], macaddr.octet[3], 
00450                macaddr.octet[4], macaddr.octet[5]);
00451     }

00453     /* IPv4 address */
00454     struct {
00455         char             *name;
00456         char             *str;
00457         cparser_result_t  result;
00458         uint32_t         ipv4addr;
00459     } get_ipv4addr_testcases[] = {
00460         { "IP4_01", "192.168.1.1", CPARSER_OK, 0xc0a80101 },
00461         { "IP4_02", "333.1.1.1", CPARSER_NOT_OK, 0x0 },
00462     };
00463     uint32_t ipv4addr;
00464     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_ipv4addr_testcases); n++) {
00465         SET_TOKEN(token, get_ipv4addr_testcases[n].str);
00466         result = cparser_get_ipv4addr(&token, &ipv4addr);
00467         num_tests++;
00468         if ((result != get_ipv4addr_testcases[n].result) || 
00469             (memcmp(&ipv4addr, &get_ipv4addr_testcases[n].ipv4addr, 4))) {
00470             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_ipv4addr_testcases[n].name);
00471         } else {
00472             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_ipv4addr_testcases[n].name);
00473             num_passes++;
00474         }
00475         printf("%s -> %d.%d.%d.%d\n", get_ipv4addr_testcases[n].str, 
00476                (int)(ipv4addr >> 24) & 0xff, (int)(ipv4addr >> 16) & 0xff, 
00477                (int)(ipv4addr >> 8) & 0xff, (int)ipv4addr & 0xff);
00478     }
00479 
00480     /* File path */
00481     struct {
00482         char             *name;
00483         char             *str;
00484         cparser_result_t  result;
00485     } get_file_testcases[] = {
00486         { "FILE01", "/usr/include/stdlib.h", CPARSER_OK },
00487         { "FILE02", "/tmp/xyz.parser", CPARSER_NOT_OK },
00488         { "FILE03", "/usr", CPARSER_NOT_OK }
00489     };
00490     char *file;
00491     for (n = 0; n < NELEM(get_file_testcases); n++) {
00492         SET_TOKEN(token, get_file_testcases[n].str);
00493         result = cparser_get_file(&token, &file);
00494         num_tests++;
00495         if ((result != get_file_testcases[n].result) || 
00496             ((CPARSER_OK == result) && 
00497              strcmp(file, get_file_testcases[n].str))) {
00498             printf("FAIL: %s: ", get_file_testcases[n].name);
00499         } else {
00500             printf("PASS: %s: ", get_file_testcases[n].name);
00501             num_passes++;
00502         }
00503         printf("%s -> %s\n", get_file_testcases[n].str, 
00504                (CPARSER_OK == result ? "OK" : "NOT OK"));
00505     }
00506 
00507     /* Keyword list */
00508     
00509     printf("Get function tests: %d total. %d passed.\n\n", 
00510            num_tests, num_passes);
00511 
00512     total_tests += num_tests;
00513     total_passes += num_passes;
00514     printf("Total=%d  Passed=%d  Failed=%d\n", total_tests,
00515            total_passes, total_tests - total_passes);
00516     return 0;
00517 }
